TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 591
TEI.2.document_title: J F Madero to John Daivs Bradburn, 02-01-1831

barker_notes.barker_summary: José Francisco Madero to Juan Davis Bradburn, February 1, 1831. His Government has every intention of scrupulously observing the law of April 6,1830, but he is sure that Bradburn's interpretation would give it an ex post facto effect, which he can not admit. (Omitted.)
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 591

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*José Francisco Madero to Juan Davis Bradburn, February 1, 1831. His Government has every intention of scrupulously observing the law of April 6,1830, but he is sure that Bradburn's interpretation would give it an ex post facto effect, which he can not admit. (Omitted.) */p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Atascosito*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="02-01-2010">February 1, 1831*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*See Calendar.*/p*
*/div1*
